intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium wainioi, commonly known as the Wainio's hawkweed, is a rare flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces achenes as its seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
